result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. April Lashay Caldwell

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Young notified the court that she is unable to appear due to the SPD conference. Case is adjourned in Branch 30, parties notified.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. 

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with A.J.C.; Barack Obama School, 5075 N. Sherman Bl., Milwaukee, WI; 
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant April Lashay Caldwell appeared by video, in custody.   Attorney Robert Hampton appeared by video for April Lashay Caldwell. Lukas Jaeger under the student practice rule appeared by video, supervised by A.D.A. Katrina Voge for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. 

This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
